title.narrative: Support to Enviromental Sectorprogramme, Phase II

description.narrative: The Danish support to the environmental sector contributes to the aims of the Bolivian Government of building a sustainable, poverty oriented development process. Phase 2 of the Danish support was initiated in 2006. The program includes five areas of activity, and is implemeted in a broad cooperation with public authorities, civil society, and the private sector. 1. Sustainable development and management of environment and natural resources, aimed at strengthening and consolidating the public envirnmental administration at central and decentralised levels. Four subcomponents are included in this: a: Implemenation of the multiyear plan of the viceministry for the environment; b: Dedectralised sustainable development; c: Support to the national program for protected areas (SERNAP); and d: Support to the national program for the administration of drainage areas(PNC). 2. Cleaner production in the industrial sector with a view to reducing the industrial pollution and increase the industrial efficiency and competitivity through cleaner technology techniques. This is implemented in cooperation with the organisation CPTS under the Bolivian Council of Industries. 3. Prevention, control, and remediation of pollution in the mining sector. Through cooperation with the state company for mining, COMIBOL, the aim is to improve the living conditions in mining areas and -villages. 4. Support for the particiaption of civil society in cooperation with a network of environmental organisations, LIDEMA. This aims at strengthening the social sense of responsibility for a sustainable development in Bolivia. 5. Support to environmental research through a strategic Bolivian research fund, PIEB. Finalisation of the programme is expected in early 2014.
